abstract: Rev Krzysztof Charamsa, who was ousted from Vatican post after acknowledging gay identity, makes public letter he sent to Pope Francis in which he again denounces Roman Catholic Church for its homophobia.
lead_paragraph: Krzysztof Charamsa made public a letter that he had sent to the pope, dated Oct. 3, in which he denounced the church, saying that it had made the lives of gay and transgender people “a hell.”
